front: compmem: memory systems can be classified according to? (key characteristics)
back: location, capacity, unit of transfer, method of accessing, performance, physical type, physical characteristics, and organization (LCUMPPPO)

front: compmem: location refers to?
back: whether memory is internal or external

front: compmem: unit of transfer refers to?
back: how much data can be read out of or written into memory at a time

front: compmem: unit of transfer for internal memory is equal to?
back: the number of electrical lines into and out of the memory module

front: compmem: unit of transfer for internal memory (‘s amt) may be equal to (...) but is often (...)

back: methods of accessing units of data

front: compmem: the four classifications of memory according to their methods of accessing units of data?
back: sequential access, direct access, random access, associative (SDRA)

back: a unique, physically wired-in addressing mechanism

front: compmem,ran: the time to access a record is (...)
back: constant and independent of the sequence of prior accesses

compmem: performance is measured with what parameters?
back: access time, memory cycle time, transfer rate (AT,MCT,TR)

front: compmem,perf: other word for access time
compmem,perf: other word for latency
compmem,perf: definition of access time for random access memory
back: the time from [instant that an address is presented to memory] TO [instant the data has been stored or made available for use]

front: compmem,perf: definition of access time for non random access memory
back: the time it takes to position the read-write mechanism at the desired location

front: compmem,perf: memory cycle time consists of (...) plus (...)
back: access time, additional time required before a second access can happen

front: compmem,perf,memcycl: additional time may be required if?
compmem,perf,memcycl: primarily applies to?
compmem,perf,memcycl: concerned with (...), not (...)
compmem,perf: definition of transfer rate
back: the rate at which data can be read from or written to a memory unit

front: compmem,perf,trrate: for random access memory, this is equal to?
compmem,perf,ttrate: for non random access memory, what equation can be applied?

back: semiconductor memory, magnetic surface memory, optical, and magneto-optical

compmem,phchar: this determines?
back: what happens to the data in memory

front: compmem,phchar: in volatile memory, what happens to data?
back: data decays naturally or is lost when electrical power is switched off

front: compmem,phchar: in nonvolatile memory, what happens to data?
back: data remains without deterioration until deliberately changed (does not need electrical power for data)

front: compmem,phchar: in nonerasable memory, what happens to data?
back: data cannot be altered except by destroying the storage unit

front: compmem,phchar: semiconductor memory can be (...) or (...)

back: physical arrangement of bits to form words
